alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 06 at 7:12AM PST until November 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE SMITH RIVER COMPLEX BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Smith River Complex burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Del Norte Interior. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Smith River Complex burn scar is expected up to and during the period of the watch. The threat of heaviest rainfall has already past. Residents near the Smith River Complex burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. The heaviest precipitation is expected in thunderstorms with forecast rain rates as high as 1.0 inch per hour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
